title: Mortifying Sin in 5 Days
description: A focused study of John Owen's practical approach to killing sin

schedule.title: The Urgency of Mortification
schedule.reflection: Consider: What sins in your life need urgent attention? How does Owen's warning 'be killing sin or it will be killing you' apply to your current struggles?

schedule.title: Understanding What Mortification Is
schedule.reflection: Reflect: How does Owen's definition of mortification as 'constant weakening' change your approach to fighting sin? What does gradual progress look like in your life?

schedule.title: The Spirit's Role in Mortification
schedule.reflection: Pray: How can you better depend on the Holy Spirit while remaining diligent in your own efforts? What means of grace do you need to use more faithfully?

schedule.title: Practical Steps
schedule.reflection: Plan: Based on Owen's teaching, what specific steps will you take this week to mortify sin? How will you measure progress?

schedule.title: Living in Victory
schedule.reflection: Commit: How will you maintain this work of mortification as a lifelong practice? What encouragements will you remember when the battle is hard?

title: Finding Comfort for Weak Faith
description: Discover Christ's tender care for struggling believers with Richard Sibbes

schedule.title: Christ's Gentle Nature
schedule.reflection: Rest: How does knowing that Christ will not break bruised reeds comfort you in your current struggles? What fears can you release to His gentle care?

schedule.title: Recognizing Your Weakness
schedule.reflection: Examine: Do you see yourself as a 'bruised reed'? How can acknowledging your weakness actually strengthen your faith in Christ's care?

schedule.title: Growing in Grace
schedule.reflection: Hope: What small evidences of grace do you see in your life? How will you nurture these 'smoking flax' signs of spiritual life?

title: Foundations of Faith
description: Build your theological foundation with Thomas Watson's systematic approach

schedule.title: Our Chief End
schedule.reflection: Purpose: How does living for God's glory change your daily priorities? What would it look like to make this your primary aim?

schedule.title: God's Word as Guide
schedule.reflection: Foundation: How can you better use Scripture as your 'compass'? What areas of life need more biblical direction?

schedule.title: Review and Application
schedule.reflection: Integration: How do these foundational truths about glorifying God and following Scripture connect? What changes will you make?

schedule.title: Living for God's Glory
schedule.reflection: Practice: Choose three specific ways you will glorify God today. How can you make this a daily habit?

schedule.title: Scripture as Authority
schedule.reflection: Submission: What areas of your life resist biblical authority? How will you bring these under God's Word?

schedule.title: Putting It Together
schedule.reflection: Synthesis: How do glorifying God and following Scripture work together in the Christian life? What have you learned?

schedule.title: Moving Forward
schedule.reflection: Commitment: What theological foundations will you continue to build on? How will you maintain regular study of doctrine?
